Package de.tub.pes.syscir.sc_model.expressions

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArrayAccessExpression
    this expression represents an arrayaccess out of the SystemC-Code it contains the array and a List of Expressions which represents the indexes of the accessed Arrayelement
    ArrayInitializerExpression
    this expression represents an Initializeation of an array out of the SystemC-Code it contains an array of Expressions which represents the dimension-values
    BinaryExpression
    this expression represents a Binary-Construct out of the systemC-Code it contains the left-hand expression, the operator and the right-hand expression a BinaryExpressions can be everything where to exressions ar conected their are, Arithmetic-Operators, Logic-Operators, relational-Operators, but also the "." for PostFix-Constructs and the "" All Operators are in the OPERATOR-Class
    BracketExpression
    this Expression is only for better reading after a print
    BreakExpression
    this Expression represents the "break"-construct, for example in Switch-Case-Constructs
    ConstantExpression
    this expression represents the constants that are used in SystemC-Code
    ContinueExpression
    this expression represents the "continue"-Construct that is used for Example in Switch-Case-Cosntructs
    Expression
    This Expression is the superclass of all Expressions
    ForLoopExpression
    this expression represents a For-Loop it contains 3 Expressions which represent the initial-construct, the final-construct and the iterator-construct it also contains a List of Expressions, which represent the Body
    FunctionCallExpression
    this expression represent a FunctionCall it contains a reference to the function and a list of Expressions which represent the Call-Parameter
    IfElseExpression
    this expression represents the If-Then-Else-Construct it contains one Expression which represent the condition anf two lists of Expressions, one represents the then-case and one the else-case
    LoopExpression
    this Expression represent the while-loop and the do-while-loop it contains an expression which represents the condition and it contains a list of Expressions which represents the body their are also two boolean Variables, one is true if its a WhileDo-Loop, one ist true if its a DoWhile-Loop
    MultiSocketAccessExpression  
    OPERATOR  
    QuestionmarkExpression
    this expression represents the Questionmark-Construct it contains one expression as Condition and two Expression which represent the if- and the else-branch
    ReturnExpression
    this expression represents the return-construct it contains an expression where the returned Expression is saved.
    SCModuleExpression
    this expression is used, if a ModuleInstance was addressed in the systemC-Code it only contains a reference to the addressed ModuleInstance
    SCPortSCSocketExpression
    this Expression is used, if a Port or a Socket was addressed in the SystemC-Code it contains a reference to the Port or Socket
    SCVariableDeclarationExpression
    this Expression represents a Variable-Declaration inside of a function it contains a Expression which refer to the Variable and an expression which represent the initial value
    SCVariableExpression
    this expression is used, if a variable was addressed in the SystemC-Code it contains a reference to the adressed variable
    SocketFunctionCallExpression
    this expression is used for a FunctionCall of a socket at the runtime of the transformation we don't know to which ModuleInstance a Port is connected so we cann't refer to a specified function, we only can save the functionname.
    SwitchExpression
    this expression represents a switch-case-cosntruct this class contains a expression which represent the switch-condition it also contains 3 maps one map maps an expression to an integer one map maps an integer to an expression the integer of the first map leads in the second map to the same expression which is his key in the first map this integer also leads to a list of Expressions in a third map, which represent the case-body their is also a List of Expression which represent the case-body
    UnaryExpression
    this Expression represents constructs where one Operator is connected whit an other expression The Operators can iterator-operators, logical-operators, and pointer-operators it also contains, besides the connected expression, two boolean-values one is true if the operator is ahead of the expression and one is true if the operator is after the expression after the expression
